result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Amber Nicole Lindberg was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amber Nicole Lindberg in court.  Attorney Adam Joseph Kachelski in court for Amber Nicole Lindberg.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

AS TO COUNT 2: Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered charge DISMISSED as a matter of law.

AS TO COUNT 3: Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 7 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 1 DAY time served. Huber privileges to apply for work.
*Must report by 5:00 pm on 9/27/2022.

*-Court ordered defendant's driving privileges REVOKED for 12 months.  
*-Defendant to install the ignition interlock device for 12 months on any vehicle owned, operated, and titled in the defendant's name.
*-Complete an AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.

*-Pay fine in the amount of $350 inclusive of ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges by 9/22/2023. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00pm on 9/23/2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.
*-Any cash bond on deposit to be applied. 

*APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN
Received and filed; forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Amber Nicole Lindberg in court with Attorney Glenn Gaskill Adam Joseph Kachelski.  Sara Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge  Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
